hanzi-su-wiki:
漁

Значения

Ловить рыбу, собирать ракушки; искать

Мнемоника

Выуживать рыбу 魚 из воды 氵.

Варианты

渔
purpleculture_pinyin:
yú
fisherman; to fish
рыбак; рыбачить
rtega_mnemonic:
漁漁RS
渔渔		to fish, seize, pursue
  • fish 魚 hauled out of the water 氵; fish 魚 pursuing each other in the water 氵
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 渔)
Ideographic: To fish 魚 in a river氵; 魚 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
漁業 [ yú yè ]: fishing industry; fishery
漁民 [ yú mín ]: fisherman; fisher folk
漁船 [ yú chuán ]: fishing boat; Classifiers: 条
漁場 [ yú chǎng ]: fishing ground
漁港 [ yú gǎng ]: fishing port
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 魚 [ yú ] fish
heisig_chinese_memo: You need water and fishes for fishing.
heisig_constituent: fishing, water, water droplets, water pistol, fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue
heisig_story: To the story we have just made about fish, this kanji for the profession of fishing adds yet another element BEFORE the others: namely the water, where the fish was happily at home before being caught, disemboweled, and eaten. Be sure to get a clear image of the water when you put it all together.
myStory:
на рыбалке ничего не поймали - нет крючка, нет ковша / удочки

русская рыбалка

ловить сеткой морепродукты и динамитом (всплеск)
koohiiStory1: You need WATER and FISH for fishing.
koohiiStory2: If you are confusing this with angling like me, take fishing to mean not the act of catching a fish but the act of being a fish not living but fishing (i.e. in the water).
jp_example_words:
漁船(ぎょせん): fishing boat
漁村(ぎょそん): fishing village
漁業(ぎょぎょう): fishing (industry)
漁師(りょうし): fisherman
jp_readingExamples: 漁業 (ぎょぎょう), 漁船 (ぎょせん), 漁村 (ぎょそん)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tsunami pushes all the fish closer to land, making for some easy fishing. The tsunami starts out in the middle of the ocean and pushes all the fish towards the coast where everyone does their fishing. With all the fish pushed closer to land and closer together, it’s very easy for people to go fishing in one spot and catch a lot of fish.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine going fishing for fish in a fishing spot after a tsunami. There are SO many fish here. Your hook barely touches the water and there’s already a fish on it. Man, fishing like this is easy! Smell the smell of fish and sea air around you.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: To get to the best fishing spot you need to go (ぎょ) row (りょう) out to the middle of the ocean. You go by means of rowing. To get to the fish and do the fishing, you need to go and row out to sea.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Go! Go row! Go and row for the fishing! How do you go? You row! The row part should be pretty easy to remember since you gotta row your boat out to sea, but if you’re having trouble with the go part, just remember that it has the same reading as 魚.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 魚 (うお、さかな、ギョ рыба)
Ru_Radicals: 汁 (суп), 杰, 田 (рисовое поле), 魚 (рыба)
Ru_trainchinese: yú: (графема) рыбачить; брать что-л., на что у тебя нет права
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if fish (魚) are in the water (氵) you can go fishing
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In the water looking for fish means you are fishing.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: There are many variants of the oracle fish characters: from " fish " to " water ", the number of fish and water varies. The most complex has four fish and two waters, and the simplest one has only one fish and one water. This form has the meaning of fishing: it is said that the word is like Linyuan envy fish, which can be obtained by fishing and hunting; others think that the word " fishing " originally has forms such as " hand " and " net ", so there is fishing It means that only because these parts were omitted later, the shape from " fish " to " water " was obtained. Second, the latter is more credible.

The word " Yu " in the oracle bone inscriptions is only used as a person's name. The name "Zi Yu" is often used in inscriptions, such as "He Ji" 369: "Zi Yu dies his cong.". The configuration of more than one fish is used as the original meaning, referring to fishing, as in "Collection" 10475: "Wang Yu, October". In addition, it may have the form of " fish " from the two " also " from the " net ", which is like a person fishing with a net with both hands. It is also used in the original meaning to mean fishing. In addition, Oracle has the character "䰻" from " fish " and " again ", which is like fishing to get a fish. However, this word is only used as a place name in the inscriptions, not for fishing or hunting.

The word " fishing " in the bronze inscription has the form from " water " to " fish ", and the number of water and fish varies. There are also " fish " from "廾", like two-handed fishing, such as fishing. There are also three types of " water ", " fish " and "廾", such as 遹𣪕. The word " fishing " in the bronze inscriptions is mostly used as the original meaning, such as 遹𣪕: "fishing in the big pond". In addition, in Wangsun Yuji, the word " fishing " is written from "水" from "鱼" from "泉". Wangsun Yuji: "The use of the king of the Chu Sun Yu", " Yu " is used as a person's name. This may refer to the Chu Si Mazi fish (see Shi Zhilian) in the Battle of Wu and Chu in the late Spring and Autumn Period.

"Shuowen" starts with " 𩼪 " and mentions "𩼪, fishing also, from 𩺰, from water. Fishing, seal text 𩼪from fish." The paragraph note considers that the word " 𩼪 " belongs to the text. Both " 𩼪 " and " fishing " have inherited the way of omitting the hand shape. The word " fishing " in the classics is often used as the original meaning, such as "Yi. "Xi Cixia": "To make a knot for a rope, and for a guilty, to use a tenant to fish."
humanum_short_description_en: The word " fishing " oracle bone inscriptions from " fish " from two " also " from " net ", like two hands holding a net to fish in the water, the original meaning is fishing. The back province is the word " fishing " from " shui " and " fish ", which is the same as the small seal collected in "Shuowen".
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文漁字異體甚多：或從「魚」從「水」，魚、水數目不一，最繁的有四魚二水，最簡的則只有一魚一水。此形所以有捕魚之意：一說認為字象臨淵羨魚，可漁獵而取之；亦有以為「漁」字本來有從「手」從「网」等形，因此有捕魚之意，只因為後來省去這些部件，才得出從「魚」從「水」之形，二說以後者較可信。

　　甲骨文中一魚一水之「漁」字只用作人名，卜辭中常見「子漁」之名，如《合集》369：「子漁亡其从」。而多於一魚的構形，則用作本義，指捕魚，如《合集》 10475：「王漁，十月」。另外，或有從「魚」從兩「又」從「网」之形，象人以雙手張網捕魚，同樣用作本義，表示捕魚的意思。另外，甲骨文又有從「魚」從「又」持竿的「䰻」字，象垂釣得魚之形。唯此字卜辭中僅用作地名，未有用作漁獵之意。

　　金文「漁」字有從「水」從「魚」之形，水、魚數目不一。另又有從「廾」從「魚」，象雙手捕魚，如漁卣。還有兼具「水」、「魚」、「廾」三者，如遹𣪕。金文中「漁」字多用作本義，如遹𣪕：「漁于大池」。另外，王孫漁戟中，「漁」字又有從「水」從「魚」從「泉」的寫法。王孫漁戟：「楚王孫漁之用」，「漁」用作人名，這裏指的可能是春秋晚期吳楚之戰中的楚司馬子魚(參石志廉)。

　　《說文》以「𩼪」為字頭，提到「𩼪，捕魚也，从𩺰，从水。漁，篆文𩼪从魚。」段注認為「𩼪」字屬籀文。「𩼪」、「漁」都承襲了省去手形的寫法。典籍中「漁」字亦多用作本義，如《易．繫辭下》：「作結繩而為罔罟，以佃以漁。」
humanum_short_description: 「漁」字甲骨文從「魚」從兩「又」從「网」，象兩手持網在水中捕魚，本義為捕魚。後省為從「水」從「魚」的「漁」字，與《說文》所收小篆同。

甲骨文漁字異體甚多：或從「 魚 」從「 水 」，魚、水數目不一，最繁的有四魚二水，最簡的則只有一魚一水。此形所以有捕魚之意：一說認為字象臨淵羨魚，可漁獵而取之；亦有以為「 漁 」字本來有從「 手 」從「 网 」等形，因此有捕魚之意，只因為後來省去這些部件，才得出從「 魚 」從「 水 」之形，二說以後者較可信。 甲骨文中一魚一水之「 漁 」字只用作人名，卜辭中常見「子漁」之名，如《合集》369：「子漁亡其从」。而多於一魚的構形，則用作本義，指捕魚，如《合集》 10475：「王漁，十月」。另外，或有從「 魚 」從兩「 又 」從「 网 」之形，象人以雙手張網捕魚，同樣用作本義，表示捕魚的意思。另外，甲骨文又有從「 魚 」從「 又 」持竿的「 䰻 」字，象垂釣得魚之形。唯此字卜辭中僅用作地名，未有用作漁獵之意。 金文「 漁 」字有從「 水 」從「 魚 」之形，水、魚數目不一。另又有從「 廾 」從「 魚 」，象雙手捕魚，如漁卣。還有兼具「 水 」、「 魚 」、「 廾 」三者，如遹𣪕。金文中「 漁 」字多用作本義，如遹𣪕：「漁于大池」。另外，王孫漁戟中，「 漁 」字又有從「 水 」從「 魚 」從「 泉 」的寫法。王孫漁戟：「楚王孫漁之用」，「 漁 」用作人名，這裏指的可能是春秋晚期吳楚之戰中的楚司馬子魚(參石志廉)。 《說文》以「 𩼪 」為字頭，提到「𩼪，捕魚也，从𩺰，从水。漁，篆文𩼪从魚。」段注認為「 𩼪 」字屬籀文。「 𩼪 」、「 漁 」都承襲了省去手形的寫法。典籍中「 漁 」字亦多用作本義，如《易．繫辭下》：「作結繩而為罔罟，以佃以漁。」
Elaboration: There are many variants of the oracle fish characters: from " fish" to " water", the number of fish and water varies. The most complex has four fish and two waters, and the simplest one has only one fish and one water. This form has the meaning of fishing: it is said that the word is like Linyuan envy fish, which can be obtained by fishing and hunting; others think that the word " fishing" originally has forms such as " hand" and " net", so there is fishing It means that only because these parts were omitted later, the shape from " fish" to " water" was obtained. Second, the latter is more credible. The word " Yu" in the oracle bone inscriptions is only used as a person's name. The name "Zi Yu" is often used in inscriptions, such as "He Ji" 369: "Zi Yu dies his cong.". The configuration of more than one fish is used as the original meaning, referring to fishing, as in "Collection" 10475: "Wang Yu, October". In addition, it may have the form of " fish" from the two " also" from the " net", which is like a person fishing with a net with both hands. It is also used in the original meaning to mean fishing. In addition, Oracle has the character " 䰻" from " fish" and " again", which is like fishing to get a fish. However, this word is only used as a place name in the inscriptions, not for fishing or hunting. The word " fishing" in the bronze inscription has the form from " water" to " fish", and the number of water and fish varies. There are also " fish" from " 廾", like two-handed fishing, such as fishing. There are also three types of" water", " fish" and " 廾", such as 遹𣪕. The word " fishing" in the bronze inscriptions is mostly used as the original meaning, such as 遹𣪕: "fishing in the big pond". In addition, in Wangsun Yuji, the word " fishing" is written from " 水" from " 鱼" from " 泉". Wangsun Yuji: "The use of the king of the Chu Sun Yu", " Yu" is used as a person's name. This may refer to the Chu Si Mazi fish (see Shi Zhilian) in the Battle of Wu and Chu in the late Spring and Autumn Period. "Shuowen" starts with " 𩼪" and mentions "𩼪, fishing also, from 𩺰, from water. Fishing, seal text 𩼪from fish." The paragraph note considers that the word " 𩼪" belongs to the text. Both" 𩼪" and " fishing" have inherited the way of omitting the hand shape. The word " fishing" in the classics is often used as the original meaning, such as "Yi. "Xi Cixia": "To make a knot for a rope, and for a guilty, to use a tenant to fish."

yú
вм. 渔
Radicals: 氵, 魚  (tsunami, fish)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tsunami pushes all the fish closer to land, making for some easy fishing. The tsunami starts out in the middle of the ocean and pushes all the fish towards the coast where everyone does their fishing. With all the fish pushed closer to land and closer together, it’s very easy for people to go fishing in one spot and catch a lot of fish.
Imagine going fishing for fish in a fishing spot after a tsunami. There are SO many fish here. Your hook barely touches the water and there’s already a fish on it. Man, fishing like this is easy! Smell the smell of fish and sea air around you.
Reading Mnemonic
To get to the best fishing spot you need to go (ぎょ) row (りょう) out to the middle of the ocean. You go by means of rowing. To get to the fish and do the fishing, you need to go and row out to sea.
Go! Go row! Go and row for the fishing! How do you go? You row! The row part should be pretty easy to remember since you gotta row your boat out to sea, but if you’re having trouble with the go part, just remember that it has the same reading as 魚.

Examples: 漁業 (ぎょぎょう), 漁船 (ぎょせん), 漁村 (ぎょそん)
汁 (суп), 杰, 田 (рисовое поле), 魚 (рыба)
Сравни: 魚 (うお、さかな、ギョ рыба)
